page.title: 01A general account of Ripe
page.content: The village of Ripe is a small community between the towns of Lewes,Hailsham and Polegate in East Sussex. It is reached by C roads, some of which are very narrow. It is therefore quiet and peaceful. The area lies between the A21 London to Eastbourne road and the A 27 Lewes to Polegate road. To the South at a distance of 2 miles from the boundary of the block are the South Downs, made of chalk. The North Downs are 20 miles distant and the plain in between is the Sussex Weald. The soil is mostly clay but a ridge of sandstone overlays it through Ripe. This makes the area good farming country. There are some 100 dwelligs in the area mostly in Ripe but a few in the nearby villages of Calvington and Firle.
